headers.title: How to create a Virtual Machine in Proxmox.
headers.author: Seon Kim
headers.subject: Management with proxmox

data.text: Creating VM is fairly simple in Proxmox. First, import the ISO of the distro then create it. The steps are the same for almost any linux distro, but I will use debian as the example.
Went to debian's download Page. I then copied the download link and went back to my server.
data.note: If your hardware uses intel or AMD (64-bit), AMD64 version should be downloaded as it supports both intel & AMD.

data.text: Go to Datacenter > node > storage > ISO Image > Dodwnload from URL. Paste in the URL into the URL field. Click Query URL then Download.
Click Create VM on the top right of the screen. Select the node you want to create the VM on. Choose a unique VM ID. Choose a name.
In OS, Choose your ISO image.
System can be left at default unless there is a specific reason to change them.
In Disks, Choose the disk in your node that you want to use and its size.
In CPU, choose the amount of sockets and cores.
In Memory, choose the amount of memory (RAM) you want. Set the minimum RAM to something low so the memory isn't allocated when it is not used.
In Network, choose the Bridge (network port) to use or you can skip with the default settings.
I learned to use iOL, IRC, and configure RAID.
